intro: Pedicularis praetermissa, commonly known as the slender monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its hemiparasitic nature, meaning it partially relies on host plants for nutrients. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple, with a distinctive hood-like structure. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
